messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] keeping up with 2 or more
messages.msgSnippet: I can imagine 3, much less 4.... although I would love to have 4 (my hubby says 2) they must be spaced no less than 3yrs apart.  DD and DS are 2 and that still
messages.messageBody:
I can imagine 3, much less 4.... although I would love to have 4 (my hubby
says 2) they must be spaced no less than 3yrs apart. DD and DS are 2 and
that still is not enough. DD is extremely spirited, so that has a lot to do
with it.

Julie -off to get 10th glass of drinks, hmmmmmmm

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] keeping up with 2 or more
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/20/00 5:53:55 AM Central Daylight Time, Jaam1224@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/20/00 5:53:55 AM Central Daylight Time, Jaam1224@...
writes:

<< Two is very exhausting trying to keep up or catch up
whichever the case my be....

Julie >>
...And I am trying to do it with 3, under 6 yo! I can only imagine how it is
for those with 4 or more little ones! :) ~Karen
